thread.title: Lady Trojans slow out the gate, fall to Sevier County | Sports | citizentribune.com
thread.title_full: Lady Trojans slow out the gate, fall to Sevier County | Sports | citizentribune.com

author: Rob Harvey, Tribune Sports Editor
title: Lady Trojans slow out the gate, fall to Sevier County | Sports | citizentribune.com
text:
Sevier County scored the first eight points of the game on Wednesday and were off from there, taking down Morristown West 69-40.
With the loss, West fell to 8-10 overall and 2-1 in District 2-4A play.
“They’re a really good team,” Morristown West coach Johnny Galyon said. “They wanted it more than us.”
Aubrie Messer led the way for West with 16 points, while Delaney Weddington and Maddie Simpson each had eight points. Other scorers for West were Haven Simpson with four points, Kalyssa Dinkins with three points and Kaylee Dyke with one point.
Cybil Penland led Sevier County with 16 points, while Kaliyah Burden had 15 points.
The Bearettes started things from the get go with eight straight points to start. West finally got on the board with a Weddington bucket, but Sevier County scored three more to lead 11-2. West scored again on a 3-pointer by Messer, but Sevier County scored seven of the last nine points of the quarter to lead, 18-7.
The second quarter was the killer for Morristown West, as they scored just eight points and gave up 24 points. Messer scored six of the points for West, but they trailed 42-15 at the half.
West tried to cut into the lead in the third, as Messer scored six of the first eight points. Messer finished with 10 points in the half, but Sevier County regrouped and led 62-33 after three.
In the fourth quarter, both teams scored seven points each as Sevier County cruised to the win. Maddie Simpson had six of West’s seven points in the final eight minutes.
Morristown West will be back in action on Friday, taking on Morristown East at East. Tip is set for 6 p.m.
